title: Supermodel Miranda Kerr has given birth to her second child with Snap CEO Evan Spiegel
text:
Snapchat CEO Evan Spiegel is now the father to two boys, his wife — supermodel Miranda Kerr — announced on Instagram.

Kerr shared with her over 12 million followers Tuesday night that she had given birth to a baby boy, and revealed that his name is Myles. This is Spiegel and Kerr's second child together, and Kerr's third son.

"We are overjoyed at the arrival of Myles and so appreciate everyone's kind words and wishes during this special time," Kerr wrote on Instagram, alongside a photo of her son's embroidered name. "We couldn't be more excited to welcome our beautiful son into our family."

✨ We are overjoyed at the arrival of Myles and so appreciate everyone's kind words and wishes during this special time. We couldn't be more excited to welcome our beautiful son into our family. ✨ A post shared by Miranda (@mirandakerr) on Oct 15, 2019 at 4:41pm PDT Oct 15, 2019 at 4:41pm PDT

Read more: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel and supermodel Miranda Kerr had their second child together. Here's a look inside their whirlwind romance.

The couple confirmed they were expecting a second child back in March, 10 months after Kerr had given birth to a baby boy named Hart, in honor of Spiegel's grandfather. Kerr also has a third son, an eight-year-old named Flynn, who she had with her ex-husband, actor Orlando Bloom.

Spiegel and Kerr have been married since May 2017. The couple first met in 2015 at a dinner for Louis Vuitton in Los Angeles. That night, the person sitting next to them — Harper's Bazaar editor-in-chief Glenda Bailey — said to Kerr, "I bet you two are going to get married."

The couple, worth a combined $3.5 billion, has kept their lives relatively private. Spiegel said in an interview last year that the couple limits Flynn — Kerr's eight-year-old — to 1.5 hours of screen time per week.

Kerr revealed in an interview last month she mops the floors of the couple's $12 million home with hot water and eucalyptus oil, and turns off almost all of the home's electricity at night — which she likened to "going camping." Kerr also shared that she has a radiation-blocking sticker on the back of her phone, a nod to a controversial theory that cell phones emit harmful rays that could cause cancer and make people sick.
